meanings.definition: Kellies: plural noun, a type of shoe with a soft upper and a sole made of rope or rubber.
meanings.sent1: I wore my comfortable kellies to the beach.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new pair of kellies for her morning walks.
meanings.sent3: The kellies were so cozy that I didn't want to take them off.
meanings.sent4: Her kellies were like clouds hugging her feet.
meanings.sent5: The colorful kellies stood out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: Kellies: verb, to kick or strike with the heel.
meanings.sent1: He kellies the ball with precision during the game.
meanings.sent2: The angry player kellies the ground in frustration.
meanings.sent3: I kellies the door closed when my hands were full.
meanings.sent4: She kellies her way through the dance routine effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The horse kellies the gate to get attention.

meanings.definition: Kellies: adjective, relating to or characteristic of the heel.
meanings.sent1: The kellies pain made her limp slightly.
meanings.sent2: He felt a kellies ache after standing all day.
meanings.sent3: The kellies discomfort was annoying but bearable.
meanings.sent4: Her kellies injury required rest and ice.
meanings.sent5: The kellies pressure from the shoes caused blisters.
